title: Scientists Just Uncovered A New Dementia Warning Sign—And It's More Common Than You Think - AOL.com
description: Some new research suggests that excessive sleepiness may be an early sign of dementia. Here's what one neurologist wants you to know about the findings.

title: Can living near golf courses give you Parkinson's? New study reveals how - Times of India
description: A recent study reveals a concerning link between living near golf courses and an increased risk of Parkinson's dise

title: New Study Reveals an Easier Alternative to Intermittent Fasting - ScienceAlert
description: Intermittent fasting is not only a useful tool for weight loss, it's also shown to have many benefits for metabolic health – independent of weight loss.

title: 7-Day No-Sugar Mediterranean Diet Meal Plan for Weight Loss, Created by a Dietitian - EatingWell
description: We skip added sugars and incorporate a week of high-fiber, high-protein meals and snacks in this dietitian-created Mediterranean diet meal plan for weight loss.

title: Measles outbreak surpasses 1,000 cases for the first time in 30 years - New York Post
description: The country’s measles outbreak has surpassed 1,000 cases for the first time in 30 years. The Centers for Disease Control and Prevention confirmed the grim news on Friday.

title: The FDA approves first U.S. at-home tool as a Pap-smear alternative - NPR
description: Women can use a wand to collect a vaginal sample, then mail it to a lab that will screen for cervical cancer. The device will be available by prescription through a telehealth service.

title: New findings suggest Alzheimer's may be reversible in some patients - WKRC
description: A new study from Harvard suggests that some Alzheimer's patients may be able to reverse the effects of the disease through some unexpected methods.

title: Protein discovered that boosts lifespan, muscle, and brain power with just one dose - Earth.com
description: Scientists studied s-KL Klotho protein therapy in aging mice, showing potential to improve muscle, bone, and memory health.

title: 'Dark photon' theory of light aims to take down the famous double-slit experiment, upending quantum physics - Earth.com
description: "Dark photon" theory says light's interference patterns may emerge from quantum particles, not waves, upending centuries of physics.

title: Study finds striking differences in life expectancy across U.S. states - The Brighter Side of News
description: A Yale study shows dramatic differences in life expectancy across U.S. states, linked directly to local health policies and social conditions.

title: My Husband Played a Terrifying Prank on Me. So I’ve Figured Out the Perfect Way to Retaliate. - Slate Magazine
Heavy Social Media Use Linked to Believing and Spreading Fake News - Neuroscience News
description: Individuals who experience high levels of distress and functional impairment from excessive social media use are significantly more likely to believe fake news and interact with it.

title: Scientists Discover Hidden Cause of Alzheimer’s Hiding in Plain Sight - SciTechDaily
description: Researchers found the PHGDH gene directly causes Alzheimer’s and discovered a drug-like molecule, NCT-503, that may help treat the disease early by targeting the gene’s hidden function. A recent study has revealed that a gene previously identified as a biomar…

title: Does Champagne Really Lower Risk of Sudden Cardiac Arrest? Here's The Science. - ScienceAlert
description: "My only regret in life is that I didn't drink enough champagne," the English economist and philosopher John Maynard Keynes (1883–1946) is reported to have said.

title: Your Brain Maps Actions Like It Maps Space - Neuroscience News
description: A new study shows that the human brain organizes action-outcome associations in cognitive maps, much like how it maps physical space for navigation.

title: AI Tool Reads Faces to Predict Health, Aging, and Cancer Outcomes - Neuroscience News
description: Researchers have developed an AI tool called FaceAge that uses facial photos to estimate biological age and predict survival outcomes in cancer patients.

title: Okra and Fenugreek Extracts Safely Remove Microplastics From Water in New Texas Research - Good News Network
description: The slimy strings from okra and the gel from fenugreek seeds can trap microplastics better than the slightly-toxic synthetic polymer in use.
